titles: The life and death of our late most incomparable and heroique prince, Henry Prince of Wales A prince (for valour and vertue) fit to be imitated in succeeding times. Written by Sir Charles Cornvvallis knight, treasurer of his Highnesse houshold.
author: Cornwallis, Charles, Sir, d. 1629.
publisher: printed by Iohn Dawson for Nathanael Butter,
notes: With an engraved frontispiece portrait of Henry, Prince of Wales.
Copy tightly bound with some loss of text; print show-through.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
keywords: Henry Frederick, --  Prince of Wales, 1594-1612 --  Early works to 1800.
Great Britain --  History --  Early Stuarts, 1603-1649 --  Early works to 1800.
